alert.note: Alert for Bibb; Houston; Jones; Monroe; Twiggs (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 28 at 4:55AM EST until January 30 at 8:30PM EST by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Georgia... Ocmulgee River near Macon affecting Bibb, Monroe, Houston, Twiggs and Jones Counties. For the Ocmulgee River Basin...including Jackson, Juliette, Griffin, Juliette, Macon, Dames Ferry, Macon, Clinchfield, Hawkinsville, Hawkinsville, Byron, Abbeville, McRae, Scotland, Lumber City...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL TUESDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Ocmulgee River near Macon. * WHEN...Until Tuesday evening. * IMPACTS...At 19.0 feet, Minor flooding continues. The Macon Greenway Ocmulgee Heritage Trail will begin to flood in areas just north of the Martin Luther King Boulevard bridge. The public should not use this portion of the trail. In addition...the lowest sections of the Charles Jones Gateway Park will flood. Portions of agricultural lands well downstream will be under two feet of water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 4:30 AM EST Sunday the stage was 18.2 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 4:30 AM EST Sunday was 21.2 feet. - Forecast...The river will fall below flood stage late this evening to 17.9 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then rise above flood stage tomorrow morning to 18.5 feet early Tuesday morning. It will fall below flood stage again early Tuesday afternoon. - Flood stage is 18.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 18.7 feet on 04/05/1979. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at weather.gov/atlanta. The next statement will be issued this afternoon at 500 PM EST.
